properties.headline: Flood Warning issued March 2 at 9:56AM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Bismarck ND has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in North Dakota...

Missouri River near Williston affecting Williams and McKenzie
Counties.

.Above normal temperatures will continue to melt the remaining
snowpack. Runoff from melting snow will increase river levels to
above minor flood stage by early Wednesday morning.

The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Missouri River near Williston.
* From Tuesday evening until further notice.
* At 8:45 AM CST Monday / 7:45 AM MST Monday the stage was 21.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 22.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage by
early Wednesday morning and continue rising to a crest of 23.5
feet early Friday afternoon.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet, Ditches in the vicinity of the river will
fill and wildlife management lands along the south banks will
begin to flood.
* Impact...At 22.0 feet, Low-lying farmland and access roads to oil
well sites near Trenton are flooded. City of Williston does not
flood.
* Impact...At 24.0 feet, Water begins to cover oil well location
south and east of Williston. Wildlife management areas are
flooded. City of Williston does not flood.
properties.instruction:
Low lying roads along the river in the Trenton Bottoms commonly
become inundated at the expected river levels. Do not drive or walk
into flood waters.

Be especially careful at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

Additional information is available on the Rivers and Lakes tab at
www.weather.gov/bis.
